Description: Lip and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Gordion cup; interior: glazed black with reserved band below offset to lip; exterior: lip glazed black; narrow black band at top of handle zone; in reserved handle zone incised handle palmette and tendril (seven petals alternating added red and black; red heart, possibly with added white dot in centre).
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.424, 1888,0601.425, 1888,0601.427, 1888,0601.215, 1948,0815.1 and Cambridge, Fitzwilliam GR.206.1894. The pieces are gathered in Hirayama, H. 2010 Kleitias and Attic Black-figure Vases in the Sixth Century B.C., pl. 25.
Bibliographic references: Brijder Siana III 2000 / Siana Cups III: The Red-black Painter, Griffin-bird Painter, and Siana Cups resembling Lip-cups (p. 556, no. G2) (Ergotimos-Kleitias Group)
Robertson 1951 / Gordion cups from Naukratis (p. 143, no. 1)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 381, no. B533)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 153, note 82)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 230, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0421) (Phase 1)
